Our Products.
Our commitment to the research and development of communications systems for healthcare providers creates industry first solutions unrivalled by any other manufacturer.


Technology.

SAFECo's highly experienced team of engineers continues to provide healthcare organizations with the most innovative products on the market, whilst ensuring maximum reliability and flexibility.

Portfolio.

Our commitment to the research and development of communications systems for healthcare providers creates industry first solutions unrivalled by any other manufacturer. A recent example of this includes releasing the only dual core processor nurse call system in the world.

Details

The momentary call/cancel station provides independent call and cancel buttons, in addition to a pendant socket for a variety of patient call requirements. An air pendant may also be connected for special applications.

The standard range is available in a variety of call button colours and membrane descriptions. The cancel button and text background are always grey. Modules are assembled on a one gang plastic plate (complete with blank surround) for wall mounting.

A call can be made by pressing the button on the call station or on a pendant connected to the station. When a call is made, a red reassurance LED below the call button illuminates. This provides a local indication that the system has received the call and guides the attending staff member to the call location. Pressing the cancel button will reset the call and extinguish the LED. This call station is ideal for patient rooms.

The call station is available with screw terminals or RJ45 connectors.

Main Features

  • Independent call and cancel buttons
  • 6.5mm passive socket for a pendant (optional)
  • Inbuilt audible indication (optional)
  • Integrated LED reassurance light to provide positive reassurance to the patient
  • Robust construction for durability and reliability
  • Assembly will fit any standard flat wall plate or service duct
  • Easy to press button, easily activated from almost any angle

Details

The latching call/cancel station provides independent call and cancel buttons, in addition to a pendant socket for a variety of patient call requirements. An air pendant may also be connected for special applications.

The standard range is available in a variety of call button colours and membrane descriptions. The cancel button and text background are always grey. Modules are assembled on a one gang plastic plate (complete with blank surround) for wall mounting.

This provides a local indication that the system has received the call and guides the attending staff member to the call location. Pressing the cancel button will reset the call and extinguish the LED. This call station is ideal for patient rooms.

The call station is available with screw terminals or RJ45 connectors.

Details

The starsmart and loopsmart multifunction station provides independent call, assist and cancel buttons, in addition to auxiliary sockets for a variety of patient/resident requirements.

The ability to connect a pendant, bed mat, floor mat, beam wand, bed wet sensor is readily available within this compact call station.

The standard range is available in a variety of call button colours and membrane descriptions. The cancel button and text background is always grey. Modules are assembled in a one gang plastic plate (complete with blank surround) for wall mounting.

A call can be made by pressing the button on the call station or on a pendant connected to the station. When a call is made, a red reassurance LED below the call button illuminates. This provides a local indication that the system has received the call and guides the attending staff member to the call location. Pressing the cancel button will reset the call and extinguish the LED. This call station is ideal for patient rooms.

The call station is only available with RJ45 connectors.

Main Features

  • independent call, assist and cancel buttons
  • 3qty 6.5mm auxiliary sockets (optional)
  • Reading light relay contact or volt DC
  • Integrated LED reassurance light to provide positive reassurance to the patient
  • Robust construction for durability and reliability
  • Assembly will fit any standard flat wall plate or service duct
  • Easy to press button
  • RTLS dual technology receivers (optional)

Details

Wet area call stations are designed for wet applications.

A moulded hood exists as physical protection. The electronics are filled with a resin and the screws are stainless steel to prevent rusting.

The entire build is waterproof and flame retardant.

Main Features

  • Moulded hood to splash proof button area
  • Resin filled electronics
  • Flame retardant material
  • Supplied with stainless steel screws to prevent rusting
  • Gasket to seal wall cavity
  • Gel filled crimp connectors
  • Screw caps

Details

The SAFair Wireless call station is available in both wet and dry area styles.

SAFair is suitable where cabling pathways may not be possible. Flexible configurations are available where the wireless station can be paired with either a receiver call station, receiver unit or a Unicall controller with built-in receiver.

The station supports fault monitoring and comes supplied with a lithium battery.

Main Features

  • LED reassurance light to provide positive reassurance to the patient
  • Off line and low batter monitoring
  • Robust construction for durability and reliability
  • Designed to meet IP66 requirements for wet areas
  • Dry area version available
  • 2 year battery life

Details

The Unicall series dome light has the provision for or segment LEDs. Five LED colours are available.

  • Cool white
  • Amber
  • Red
  • Blue
  • Green
The white translucent dome cover clips to the moulded base and illuminates with the colour of the selected LED. Available in standard, intelligent and dementia versions.

Main Features

  • High luminosity
  • RJ45 sockets allows one CAT5/6 cable to be daisy chained to more than one over door LED light
  • Screw terminal allows easy activation of inputs for non-CAT5/6 installations
  • Up to 4 outputs available with various colours available per output
  • Structured CAT5e provides seamless integration into Unicall controller
  • Output Selection, the installer can select which output line on the CAT5/6 cable will activate on

Details

Pendants can be implemented into any call station by the addition of a pendant socket.

Pendants have up to two options for the patient. A green pushbutton can be used for nurse call and a yellow bed light button can also be implemented.

Main Features

  • White plastic housing
  • Fits comfortably in hand
  • Green Pushbutton
  • Optional Yellow bed light button
  • 6.35mm TRS jack

Details

A breif description on what the HANDSETS does. Write what a viewer of the page wants to know (not spec and implementation details).

Main Features

  • Slim ergonomic design
  • Shaped to fit comfortably in the hand
  • 3.5ml earphone socket
  • Nurse call button
  • Built in torch
  • Button which enables bed light
  • Volume up/down buttons
  • Channel up/down buttons

Details

SAFECo Annunciators are available in both LED 13 character dot matrix displays and as 24" - 65" monitors.

The LED dot matrix annunciator is tri-colour and can be read from distances as far as 30 metres away, ideal for ward corridors.

When an active call is present on the system the annunciator will display the highest priority call, alternating between multiple calls of the same priority at 2 second intervals. Nurse calls will display in green, ensuite calls in amber, assist in yellow and emergency in red.

Main Features

  • Visible from up to 30m
  • Robust construction for durability and reliability
  • Can display the time when no active calls exist
  • White housing

Details

The SAFECo entertainment handset provides patients with nurse call, light switch and a built-in torch. The entertainment control buttons interface to all modern hardwired television systems.

An inbuilt speaker provides the patient with clear audio without disturbing other patients. For further privacy, an earphone socket allows patients to use modern audio headsets.

A light switch allows the patient to control the overbed light and is backlit to assist in its location at night.

The integrated nurse call button is readily located by its prominent position, and a soft green light identifies the button at night. When the nurse call button is pressed, the green light changes to red, acknowledging that the patient has pressed the button.

The handset bracket provides secure mounting when the handset is not being used.

Main Features

  • Handset housing shaped to fit comfortably in the hand
  • Robust construction for durability and reliability
  • Custom cradle provides secure storage when not in use
  • White housing with 2.5M cable and 18 pin plug
  • Waterproof speaker
  • Earphone socket
  • Nurse call button
  • Reading light and torch button

Details

The SAFECo waterproof pager is a combination of reliable POCSAG technology with a practical modern design applied. The pager is small and lighter weight than traditional pagers, is sealed and rechargeable.

Charging stations are available as a single charger or 10 way multi dock. Once fully charged typical battery time before requiring recharge is 5 days.

Main Features

  • Sleek Modern Design
  • Supplied with Belt Clip
  • No Need to replace battery, rechargeable
  • Compatible with existing paging systems
  • Hand programmable
  • Thinnest Pocsag Pager in the world
  • Anti-Bacterial plastic suitable for hospital use
  • Up to 8 paging addresses (capcodes)
  • Battery Charge indicator
  • 8 different melody alerts
  • Built-in vibrator for vibration alert
  • Multi-Language support
  • 20 characters 4 or 8 line mode

Our new Staff tracking and Patient Wandering Solution

SAFECo has a range of Positional Duress, Staff tracking and Patient Wandering Solutions available tailored to your facilities requirements. The system can locate with scalable accuracy from general area to room location by utilising state of the art dual RF and Ultrasonic technology to ensure assistance is on the way when it is needed most.

Location information can be integrated into wireless messaging as well as the aid of a graphical display which can be distributed via a thin client on Local Area Network workstation PCs. Fixed annunciators in designated areas can also display location information.

This technology is incorporated within our Unicall Nurse call stations to dramatically reduce the TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) for healthcare facilities. Facilities can now be confident that staff, residents and patients have peace of mind that safety and care is a priority.

Details

The new Quickpass logging and paging system is the latest in nurse call integration technology, utilising the popular Microsoft SQL database, options for exporting and extracting data is completely user customisable, while keeping simplicity of use in mind. The logging system is capable for site linking, so if your facility has multiple sites, the history and data can be combined for comparison.

The system is designed to support the latest operating systems and is compatible with multiple systems. For example, it can log BMS alarms (Honneywell/ Schnieder/ TAC), Nurse call alarms (Smartlink, Sedco, Austco, Questek, Raulands and Careplus), fire alarms and generic party systems.

Should a custom interface be required, we can program event strings on the fly to match your equipment. We can also implement client specified advertising on the software such as company logo, canteen lunch menus or community events that can be broadcasted on multiple monitors throughout the facility.

Details

The SAFECo dementia keypad and dementia dome are intelligent expansion units to the Unicall system controllers. The units provide additional automation and unobtrusive monitoring of a resident within a room. With reed switches, motion sensors, bed mats and floor mats, staff can arm and disarm the system via the keypad installed outside the room.

The system can monitor if a resident gets out of bed at night to automatically turn on the light in the bathroom, and generate an alarm if the resident doesn't return to bed within a predefined time.

Alternatively, if the resident doesn't go to the bathroom the system will generate a wandering alarm.

If the motion sensor is triggered while the resident is still in bed, an intruder alarm will be triggered.

Main Features

  • 4 predefined profiles
  • Arm/disarm from the keypad
  • Alarm status indicators
  • Auxiliary output for switching ensuite light
  • Accept reed switch and motion sensors
  • 2 press arming to stop residents from tampering with system operation
